author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

segments.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā, indriyesu aguttadvāratā, bhojane amattaññutā.
segments.en: They relish work, talk, and sleep. They don’t guard the sense doors and they eat too much.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

segments.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

segments.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā.
segments.en: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They guard the sense doors and they have moderation in eating.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.”
